docs.snippet: Thursday: Sprucing up the city, revisiting a mob figure, and breaking ground on the subway.
New York has added 3,000 bioswales, or rain gardens, to absorb storm water and ease pressure on an aging sewer system. But not everyone is pleased.

headline.print_headline: To the City, a Green Pollution Fighter. To Some Residents, an Eyesore.
headline.main: To the City, a Pollution Fighter. To Some Residents, an Eyesore

docs.snippet: The recording, which appears to depict unarmed members of the Rohingya minority being beaten in Rakhine State, adds to pressure on the government.

headline.print_headline: Myanmar Holds Officers After Video Seems to Show Beating of Rohingya
headline.main: Myanmar Holds Officers After Video Purports to Show Police Beating Rohingya

docs.snippet: Visitors flocked to the newly opened Georgia O’Keefe exhibit, which features the artist’s wardrobe, along with key paintings and photographs.

headline.print_headline: What 8 New Yorkers Wore to First Saturday at the Brooklyn Museum
headline.main: What 8 New Yorkers Wore to First Saturday at the Brooklyn Museum

docs.snippet: Donald J. Trump lashed out about crowd sizes at his swearing in and opted to rewrite the history of his dealings with intelligence agencies.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Trump’s Way, Samsung Fires, Snapchat’s Hard Line

docs.snippet: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack carried out by Khalid Masood, 52, who had a criminal record but was not on any police-monitoring lists.

headline.print_headline: Toll Is Global  for an Attacker  Born in Britain
headline.main: Toll of London Attack Is Global for an Assailant Born in Britain

docs.snippet: The companies cited concerns that Google was not doing enough to prevent brands from appearing next to offensive material, like hate speech.

headline.print_headline: Advertisers Flee YouTube Over Worries on Placement
headline.main: AT&T and Johnson & Johnson Pull Ads From YouTube

docs.snippet: The Academy Award nominations come out Tuesday, and films like “Moonlight,” “Silence,” “Lion” and “20th Century Women” may gain box office momentum.

headline.main: Art-House Fare Hopes for an Oscar-Nod Push, as ‘Split’ Rules North America

docs.snippet: Mr. Barra, a Google veteran who ran Xiaomi’s global division, said he was moving back to Silicon Valley. His departure comes as the company is struggling.

headline.print_headline: Xiaomi Loses a Global Face as a Google Veteran Exits
headline.main: Xiaomi, Chinese Phone Maker, Losing Its Global Face as Hugo Barra Exits

docs.snippet: The man on trial had admitted shooting Mr. Kem Ley, a government critic. But glaring holes in the case, which recalled past assassinations, raise troubling questions.

headline.print_headline: A Life Sentence in Cambodia, but a Political Murder Is Far From Solved
headline.main: A Life Sentence in Cambodia, but Kem Ley’s Murder Is Far From Solved
